thread.title: Austin Dillon Wins Xfinity Series Race At Charlotte
thread.title_full: Austin Dillon Wins Xfinity Series Race At Charlotte

title: Austin Dillon Wins Xfinity Series Race At Charlotte
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Austin Dillon Wins Xfinity Series Race At Charlotte CONCORD, N.C.- Austin Dillon dodged fireworks before the race and coasted to an Xfinity Series victory at Charlotte Motor Speedway on Friday night. Post to Facebook Austin Dillon Wins Xfinity Series Race At Charlotte CONCORD, N.C.- Austin Dillon dodged fireworks before the race and coasted to an Xfinity Series victory at Charlotte Motor Speedway on Friday night.  //on.wfmy.com/1Ln1CfY   Austin Dillon Wins Xfinity Series Race At Charlotte Associated Press 12:32 a.m. EDT October 10, 2015 during the NASCAR XFINITY Series Drive for the Cure 300 at Charlotte Motor Speedway on October 9, 2015 in Charlotte, North Carolina. (Photo: Sean Gardner) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CONCORD, N.C.- Austin Dillon dodged fireworks before the race and coasted to an Xfinity Series victory at Charlotte Motor Speedway on Friday night. 
Dillon led 61 laps and help off Erik Jones to complete a season sweep at the track. The Sprint Cup driver has four victories this season in the second-tier series. 
Dillon's night started with a scare when fireworks from a pre-race celebration landed near his back as he was leaning on his No. 33 Chevrolet after introductions. 
The pole sitter was startled when fireworks landed on his car, causing him to jump out of the way along with his girlfriend Whitney Ward. He let out a wide smile after realizing what had happened. 
His fire suit was slightly singed. 
Kyle Busch led 102 laps before his night ended when he hit the wall after Kasey Kahne tapped him from behind with 50 laps remaining. 
Series leader Chris Buescher finished seventh to maintain his points lead. Read or Share this story: http://on.wfmy.com/1Ln1CfY TOP VIDEOS
